alert.note: Alert for Langlade; Lincoln; Northern Oconto County (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 11:53AM CDT until March 30 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FREEZING RAIN LIKELY TO PRODUCE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING... .A complex storm system will continue develop over the Plains this afternoon, then shift across the area tonight through Thursday. The initial surge of precipitation moving out ahead of the storm will push across the area tonight into Wednesday morning. The precipitation will likely begin as a mix of snow, sleet and freezing rain, change to mainly freezing rain during the night, and then to just rain as temperatures edge above freezing Wednesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Minor snow and sleet accumulation and ice accretion of up to a quarter inch. * WHERE...Langlade, Lincoln and Northern Oconto County Counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 9 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions, including for the Wednesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The precipitation will change to rain during the day Wednesday. It will transition back to snow Wednesday evening, probably continuing into Thursday morning, with several inches of accumulation possible.
info.instruction: If you will be traveling tonight or Wednesday morning, allow extra time to reach your destination. Slow down and use extra caution. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
